alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain.

Hazards:
Toonie size hail.
Wind gusts up to 70 km/h.
Locally heavy rainfall.

Timing:
This evening into the overnight.

Discussion:
Strong thunderstorms are expected to track across portions of southern Ontario tonight.

###

Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

affected_areas.area_description: Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County
Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County

alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring.

Patches of dense fog will dissipate later tonight.

###

Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: fog advisory ended
alerts.description:
Visibilities have improved and are no longer expected to meet fog advisory criteria.


###

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch ended
alerts.description:
Conditions are no longer favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms.


###

affected_areas.area_description: Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County
Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Potential for heavy rainfall and thunderstorms tonight. 

What:
Localized rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm.

When:
Tonight.

Additional information:
Numerous showers and thunderstorms associated with a warm front are expected to affect portions of the area. Areas that are affected by several thunderstorms may receive as much as 50 mm of rain.

Localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads are possible.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots are expected or occurring in the area.

These thunderstorms will move across western portions of Lake Erie over the next couple of hours.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
